comments.author: dan
comments.text:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Place a piece on the grid
2. Click on the placed piece to pick it up and remove it
3. Try to place the same piece again in a different location (or the same location)
4. The placement is incorrectly rejected even though the area should be empty

Expected: The piece should be placeable in the empty area since it was just removed.
Actual: Collision detection seems to still think the space is occupied.

Likely cause: When a piece is picked up from the board, the occupiedSquares set may not be properly cleared, leaving phantom occupied space markers.

title: Code Architecture Refactoring
description: Address separation of concerns in the codebase. The main index.html is 1510 lines mixing game logic, UI rendering, input handling, storage, and state management. This epic tracks modularization to improve maintainability and testability.

title: Extract game logic module (gameLogic.js)
description: Extract game logic from index.html into dedicated gameLogic.js module. Should include: checkWinCondition(), placePiece() (new function for atomic placement), removePiece() (extract from 3 duplicated locations), stats tracking logic, daily reset logic. This addresses the god-object anti-pattern where gameState mixes domain and UI concerns.

title: Add JSDoc type hints for complex objects
description: No TypeScript or JSDoc type hints exist for complex objects. placedPieces Map structure is unclear ({row, col, orientationIndex}), no type definitions for placement data, no validation that stored data matches expected schema. Add JSDoc comments defining: Placement type, GameState type, UIState type, Stats type. Improves IDE support and documentation.

title: Add throttling to touch event handlers
description: Mouse movement is throttled to 60fps (lines 1142-1157), but touch events (touchmove at lines 1309-1320) do not respect this throttle. This can cause frame drops on mobile devices. Apply the same requestAnimationFrame throttling pattern used for mouse events to touch events.

title: Research: Replace isInteractingWithButton workaround
description: isInteractingWithButton flag (line 602) is a coordination hack to prevent piece deselection when interacting with UI buttons. This adds gameState pollution for UI coordination. Research better solutions: 1) Event delegation pattern, 2) pointer-events CSS, 3) Explicit event.stopPropagation(), 4) Separate click handlers with proper event targeting.

title: Separate UI state from game state
description: Split gameState into two distinct objects: gameModel (domain logic: placedPieces, occupiedSquares) and uiState (rendering: mousePos, selectedPiece, highlightedPiece, isInteractingWithButton). This violates Single Responsibility Principle - mousePos and isInteractingWithButton are UI coordination flags that don't belong in game state. Separating them makes game logic testable without UI.

title: Extract rebuildOccupiedSquares() helper
description: Extract duplicate occupiedSquares rebuild logic to a single helper function. Currently duplicated in 3+ locations (lines 932-940 removePieceFromGrid, 1196-1205 click handler, 1378-1388 escape key handler). Each contains the same pattern: clear set, iterate placedPieces, add coordinates. DRY violation makes bugfixes risky - must change all locations.

title: Consolidate transformation logic - remove duplicate flipPiece()
description: flipPiece() in index.html (lines 856-882) reimplements rotation/flip logic that already exists in pieces.js (rotateCoords, flipCoords, generateOrientations). This duplicate logic must be maintained in two places. Solution: expose a cycleOrientation() function from pieces.js that handles rotation/flip state changes, or refactor flipPiece to use existing pieces.js functions.

title: Extract rendering module (renderer.js)
description: Extract canvas rendering logic from index.html into renderer.js. Should include: drawGrid(), drawPiece(), drawPreview(), draw() main orchestrator, canvas setup/sizing. Currently lines 558-591 (canvas setup), 960-1138 (all drawing functions). This separates visual presentation from game logic and input handling.

title: Extract storage module (storage.js)
description: Extract localStorage persistence logic from index.html into storage.js. Should include: saveGameState(), loadGameState(), saveStats(), loadStats(). Currently scattered across lines 607-711. Also add proper error handling - current try/catch silently fails with no user feedback. Consider adding data validation for loaded state schema.

title: Extract input handler module (inputHandler.js)
description: Extract event handling logic from index.html into inputHandler.js. Should include: all mouse event handlers (1145-1290), touch/gesture handlers (1291-1440), keyboard handlers (1365-1425). Currently 300+ lines of event handling mixed with state mutations. This module should delegate to game logic and trigger rendering, not implement business logic directly.

title: Use grid.js utilities in checkWinCondition()
description: checkWinCondition() (lines 884-903) reimplements grid iteration instead of using grid.js utilities. It manually iterates and checks square types. Should use getAllSquares() from grid.js and check against occupiedSquares Set. Reduces code duplication and keeps grid logic centralized.

title: Research: Evaluate testing strategy for refactored modules
description: Once game logic is separated from UI, evaluate adding unit tests. Research: 1) Test framework options (Jest, Vitest, native Node test runner), 2) What to test first (game logic, win conditions, piece transformations), 3) How to mock grid/pieces modules, 4) Whether to add CI/CD for tests. Document findings before implementing tests.

title: Mobile Experience & Touch Controls
description: Comprehensive mobile support with responsive layout, touch controls, gestures, performance optimization, and accessibility for all mobile devices. See docs/mobile-experience.md for full specification.

title: Active piece outline invisible when overlapping other pieces
description: Bug: The outline of the active/rotating piece is hard to see when it overlaps with other pieces on the board, making it difficult to see which way the piece is rotating. Solution: Render the active piece on top layer with full opacity. Use a consistent, unique color for all active pieces and consider adding a unique texture or visual pattern to make it always distinguishable from static pieces.

title: Canvas DPI scaling for retina/high-DPI displays
description: Scale canvas rendering by device pixel ratio to prevent blurriness on retina and high-DPI mobile screens. Adjust drawing coordinates proportionally.

title: Responsive canvas sizing for mobile screens
description: Make SQUARE_SIZE responsive based on viewport width. On mobile (<480px), reduce canvas size to prevent excessive scrolling. Should support 320px-1024px screens.

title: Touch event detection and zoom gesture prevention
description: Prevent double-tap zoom and pinch zoom on mobile. Add touch-action: manipulation CSS. Detect touch capability to enable/disable hover hints. Prevent default browser behaviors.

title: Touch-first feedback (hide hover, show active/focus states)
description: Hide hover-based hints and UI elements on touch devices. Use active/focus pseudo-classes for touch feedback. Consolidates previous hover and focus state tasks.

title: Rotate/flip buttons don't work with active piece - piece disappears
description: Bug: Clicking rotate or flip buttons while a piece is active causes the piece to disappear, likely being returned to the tray. This is probably triggered by the desktop rule where moving mouse out of puzzle area returns the piece. On mobile with button controls, activating a piece and then tapping rotate/flip should work, but instead triggers the 'piece left area' behavior.

title: Mobile device performance profiling
description: Profile and optimize canvas rendering for mid-to-low-end Android and older iOS devices. Target 60fps on touch interactions.

title: Swipe up gesture for flip causes page scrolling on mobile
description: Bug: Swipe left gesture for rotation works well without scrolling, but swipe up gesture for flip still causes the page to scroll vertically. Need to prevent default scroll behavior specifically for the swipe up gesture, similar to how swipe left is handled.

title: Piece should only lock on tap without movement, not on movement stop
description: Bug: On mobile, pieces lock/place as soon as the user lifts their finger, even if they were moving the piece. This makes it hard to precisely position pieces. Expected behavior: Pieces should only lock when the user taps/clicks without moving the piece. Moving the piece should allow the user to reposition it without locking. Related: The placement indicator (crosshair) should always be visible to show the target cell, especially important when allowing movement before placement.
